greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: One-based row index of n in array A256995.
comment: Also one-based column index for array A256997.
a(1) = 0 by convention, as 1 is outside of the actual arrays A256995 & A256997.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
formula: a(1) = 0; for n > 1, if A213714(n) = 0 [i.e., if n is one of the terms of A055938], then a(n) = A234017(n), otherwise a(n) = a(A213714(n)).
In other words, a(1) = 0, and for n > 1, if n = A055938(k) for some k, then a(n) = k, otherwise it must be that n = A005187(h) for some h, in which case a(n) = a(h).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 14 2015
